timeline.bodyText: do you know why 1.8.0 doesn't work?
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: It looks like the instrumentation is built against a fork source code of etaty/rediscala. Let's catch up later to discuss which library we should be supporting.
replies.author: richardstartin

timeline.bodyText: Looks like the original classes are duplicated instead of being moved/renamed properly.
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I hadn't added staged the deletions, good catch.
replies.author: richardstartin

timeline.message: add version to rediscala instrumentation name, update referenced dd class names, use random port for test

timeline.bodyText: if both are commonly used and we are able to work with either one, I suggest adding both checks to muzzle.
timeline.author: tylerbenson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -4,21 +4,21 @@ ext {
 
 muzzle {
   pass {
-    group = "com.github.Ma27"
+    group = "com.github.etaty"
     module = "rediscala_2.11"
-    versions = "[1.8.1,)"
+    versions = "[1.8.0,)"
     assertInverse = true
   }
 
   pass {
-    group = "com.github.Ma27"
+    group = "com.github.etaty"
     module = "rediscala_2.12"
-    versions = "[1.8.1,)"
+    versions = "[1.8.0,)"
     assertInverse = true
   }
 
   pass {
-    group = "com.github.Ma27"
+    group = "com.github.etaty"
     module = "rediscala_2.13"
     versions = "[1.9.0,)"
     assertInverse = true

replies.bodyText: OK, done. Note that there is no Ma27 1.8.0, it starts at 1.8.1
replies.author: richardstartin

timeline.message: add version to rediscala instrumentation name, update referenced dd class names, use random port for test
expand scope of etaty rediscala instrumentation
expand scope of etaty rediscala instrumentation

timeline.bodyText: We might want a second latestDepTest source set that uses the latest from the fork
timeline.author: devinsba

replies.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: Spoke to @tylerbenson, will address this on another PR.
replies.author: richardstartin
